country_overview.content: Singapore, a global financial hub in Southeast Asia, is renowned for its modern skyline, efficient public services, and multicultural society. It attracts tourists, business travelers, and students from around the world. Singapore offers various visa options depending on the purpose of the visit, and its visa policy is well-organized and transparent.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: Issued to foreign nationals who wish to visit Singapore for tourism, sightseeing, and casual visits to friends or relatives.

business_visa.title: Business Visa
business_visa.description: For individuals visiting Singapore for business meetings, trade negotiations, or other business-related activities.

student_visa.title: Student Visa
student_visa.description: Issued to students who have been accepted to a recognized educational institution in Singapore.

employment_pass.title: Employment Pass
employment_pass.description: For foreign nationals employed by a Singaporean company or organization.

work_holiday_pass.title: Work Holiday Pass
work_holiday_pass.description: For foreign nationals who wish to work and holiday in Singapore under specific agreements.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must demonstrate the purpose of their visit is purely for tourism and that they have sufficient funds to support themselves during their stay.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of travel arrangements (e.g., flight itinerary)

business_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have an invitation from a Singaporean company or organization for business purposes.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Letter of invitation from the Singaporean company
Company registration documents of the inviting company in Singapore

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have an acceptance letter from a recognized educational institution in Singapore.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Acceptance letter from the educational institution
Proof of financial means to support education and stay in Singapore

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on the purpose of your visit to Singapore.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for the selected visa type.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all mandatory and additional documents as specified for the visa type.

step_4.title: Fill Out the Application Form
step_4.description: Complete the visa application form available on the Singapore government's official visa website.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit the completed application form and documents either online or at the nearest Singaporean embassy or consulate.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: Wait for the visa application to be processed. Processing times vary depending on the visa type and your country of residence.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once approved, receive your visa either electronically or stamped in your passport.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees vary depending on the type of visa, duration of stay, and nationality of the applicant. The fees are non-refundable and must be paid at the time of application.

processing_time.content: Processing times can range from a few days to a few weeks, depending on the visa type and the applicant's country of residence.

visa_validity.content: Visa validity varies by visa type. Tourist visas are typically valid for 30 days, while business and employment visas may be valid for up to a year or more.

entry_requirements.content: Visa holders must enter Singapore within the validity period of the visa. Overstaying a visa can result in fines or other penalties.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Singapore?
faq_1.answer: Certain types of visas can be extended, but this must be done before the current visa expires. Extensions are granted at the discretion of Singaporean authorities.

faq_2.question: Is visa-free entry available for Singapore?
faq_2.answer: Yes, citizens of many countries can enter Singapore visa-free for short stays, typically up to 90 days.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Singapore on a tourist visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a tourist visa is strictly prohibited. You must apply for an employment pass if you intend to work in Singapore.
